All buildings constructed of wood or metal must be stained or painted with two coats of paint. (d) there shall not be constructed any outside toilets. (8) That no part of the land hereby conveyed, or the improvements there- on, shall ever be sold, leased, traded, rented or donated to any one other than the Caucasian race. (f) There shall be no live stock animal or poultry kept or maintained on the property other than household pets. (g) The parcels hereby conveyed shall be used only for residential pur- poses, No revenue stamp required. Consideration less than one hundred dollars. I, Ethel W. column12: I, ALBERT L, BOURGEOIS of Lowell, Middlesex County, Massachusetts 491 for consideration paid, grant to Christopher C. Cox and Mary E. Cox, Bourgeois husband and wife, as tenants by the entirety, both of said Lowell, with to \UITCLAIM COVENANTS, the land with the buildings thereon situated in Cox Dracut in said County and being known as lots 132, 133 as shown on a Revised plan of the subdividion known and designated as Varnum Town, Dracut, Mass,, together with an easement of right of way over the streets roads, places, drives or avenues shown on said Map. Subject to the right to install telegraph, telephone, electric light poles and wires, gas and water mains or to give licenses or permits for the same in such streets, roads, places, drives or avenues. Said land is conveyed sub- ject to the following restrictions: (a) There shall be no building, porch or projection extending over a line twenty (20) feet from roads bordering each parcel or four (4) feet from each side boundary of the parcel as distinguished from the front and rear boundaries of each parcel. (>) There shell be no building constructed or erected on this property of a less width of 18 feet or length of 20 feet. (c) There shall be no building constructed or erected on this property other than a one family dwelling and private garage which must conform with building. All buildings constructed of wood or metal must be stain- ed or painted with two coats of paint. (d) There shall not be constructed any outside toilets. (e) That no part of the land hereby conveyed, or the improvements there- on shall ever be sold, leased, traded, rented or donated to any one other than the Caucasian race. (f) There shall be no live stock animal or poultry kept or maintained ‘ 945 492 Benham Notice 493 Taylor to Middlesex Co-op, Bank Lowell 216 on the property other than household pets. (g) The parcels hereby conveyed shall be used only for residential purposes. Being the same premises to me conveyed by Christopher C. Cox and Mary EB. Cox by their deed of even date to be recorded simultaneous- ly herewith, The consideration {is less than one hundred dollars ($100.) I, Doris R. Bourgeois, wife of gaid grantor, release to said grantee_ all rights of DOWER AND HOMESTEAD and other interests therein. WITNESS our hands and seals this seventeenth day of May 1940. Albert L. Bourgeois Doris R. Bourgeois The Commonwealth of Massachusetts Middlesex ss. Lowell, May 17, 1940.

column12: (Start of deed) WE, Maria M. Lenfest and Granville S. Lenfest, husband and wife, both of Holliston, Middlesex County, Massachusetts, for consideration paid, grant to Frank W. Marshall of Medford, in said County of Middlesex, with quitclaim covenants, the land in Wilmington, Massachusetts. Being a portion of Lot numbered one hundred and twenty-four (124) on a plan of Silver Lake, bounded and described as follows: Commencing on Cottage Avenue, so called, at land of Charles B. McLeod; Thence southwesterly by said McLeod land two hundred (200) feet, more or less, to land of Alexander; Thence turning and running easterly fifty (50) feet by said Alexander land to land of Alice J. Grieves; Thence turning and running northeasterly two hundred (200) feet, more or less, to said Cottage Avenue; Thence turning and running westerly fifty (50) feet by said avenue to the point of beginning. This conveyance is made subject to the following restrictions: that the said premises are to be used as a place of residence only and are not to be occupied or conveyed to any Negroes or any person or persons that would be considered disorderly people. I, Granville S. Lenfest, husband of Maria M. Lenfest, release to said grantee all rights of courtesy and homestead and other interests therein. WITNESS our hands and seals this 10th day of May, 1924. Maria M. Lenfest (seal) Granville S. Lenfest (seal) Commonwealth of Massachusetts Middlesex ss. May 12, 1924 Then personally appeared the above-named Maria M. Lacasse dated April 20, 1938 and recorded with said Registry of Deeds, Book 912, ‘Page 164, and one from Octave Lacasse to Albert Lacasse and Florence Lacasse dated May 29,1942 and recorded with said Registry of Deeds, Book 978, Page 299. This mort- gage is upon the Statutory Condition, and also upon the condition that the grantors or their heirs, executors, administrators or assigns shall pay on demand to the grantee or its successors or assigns all such sums as they shall pay for taxes and assessments or to satisfy any claims or liens on the granted premises and for insurance on the buildings on said premises with interest; shall keep all policies of insurance on the buildings on said premises first payable to the grantee, or its successors or assigns, and shall keep all such policie deposited with the grantee, or its successors or assigns; and shall ] not commit or suffer any breach of any law or ordinance relating to buildings on said premises; for any breach of which conditions the mortgagee shall have the Statutory Power of Sale, said sale to be at any place in said Lowell or Dracut. The grantee and its successors or assigns are hereby appointed and constituted the attorney or attorneys irrevocable of the grantors to cancel any policy or policies of in- surance on the buildings on said premises in case this mortgage shall be foreclosed, and to apply the proceeds therefrom to the indebtedness secured by this mortgage, and the acceptance of a deed of the granted premises by any successors in title to the grantors while this morte gage is outstanding shall be a sufficient ratification of this ap- pointment and also of the appointment of such attorney as provided by the Statute. ‘We furthermore release to the grantee all rights of DOWER AND HOMJSTEAD, tenancy by the CURTESY, and all other interests in the mortgaged premises, and covenant with the grantee and its suc-  519 Blake to Fairweather 172 cessors or assigns to join in any deed required to confirm any sale g _made as herein or in the Statute provided. column12: We, George Beaulieu and Courana L. Beaulieu, husband and wife, both of Dracut, Middlesex County, Massachusetts, for consideration paid, grant to UNION NATIONAL BANK OF LOWELL, a body corporate, located at Lowell, in said County of Middlesex, with MORTGAGE COVENANTS, to Secure the payment of FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($5000) , with interest frorn date at the rate of five per centum (5%) per annum on the unpaid balance until paid, said principal and interest being payable in installments as follows: Fifty-three and 5/100 Dollars ($53.05) in one month from date; Fifty-three and 5/100 Dollars ($53.05) every month thereafter; and the final payment of principal and interest in ten (10) years from date, as provided in our note of even date, and also to secure the performance of all covenants and seveements herein contained, the following described parcels of land Situated in said Dracut: FIRST: The land, with the buildings thereon, situated on the southerly side of Long Pond Drive and the westerly side of Shore Drive, and thus bounded and described: _ Northerly by said Long Pond Drive, one hundred ninety (190) feet; _ Easterly by said Shore Drive, one hundred fifty (150) feet: , Southerly by land now or formerly of Bernard O’Reilly, one hundred ninety-four (194) feet; and : Westerly by Long Pond, one hundred seventy (170) feet. Being shown on a plan of land entitled, ‘‘Revised Plan of Varnumtown at Long Pond Dracut, Mass owned by F. E. Kroker,’’ surveyed Nov. 30, 1938 by Brooks, Jordan & Graves, C. E’s., and recorded with Middlesex North District Registry of Deeds, Plan Book 61, Plan 88. oo , Being the Same premises conveyed to us by Fred E. Kroker by deed dated July 9, 1938, and recorded with said Registry of Deeds; Book 916, Page 98. Said premises are conveyed with full business rights and the right to conduct a bathhouse, parking, erect tourist camps or overnight cabins is granted with this parcel of land. LS fd SII Gy wreyerrd 77S The above parcel of land is subject to the following restrictions: BOOK (a) There shall be no building, porch or projection extending {142 over a line fifteen (15) feet from the roads bordering this parcel. (b) All buildings constructed of wood or metal must be stained PAGE or painted. (c) There shall not be constructed any outside toilets. 251 (d) No part of the land hereby conveyed or the improvements thereon shall ever be sold, leased, traded, rented or donated to any- one other than the Caucasian race. (e) There shall be no livestock, animals or poultry kept or maintained on the property other than household pets. SECOND: The land situated on the southerly side of Long Pond Drive, easterly Side of Shore Drive, northerly side of Maple Road, and the northwesterly side of Hillside Terrace, and thus bounded and described: Northerly by said Long Pond Drive, three hundred ninety-four and 3/100 (394.03) feet; Westerly by said Shore Drive, one hundred seventy-five (175) feet; Southerly by said Maple Road, three hundred seventy-nine and 64/100 (379.64) feet; Southeasterly by said Hillside Terrace, one hundred twenty and 97/100 (120.97) feet; and Northeasterly by said Long Pond Drive, ninety-eight and 16/100 (98.16) feet. Said premises are shown on said plan and are conveyed with the benefit of, and subject to, said benefits and restrictions as set forth in parcel 1, and are the same premises conveyed to said George Beaulieu and Courana L. Beaulieu, under the name of Courana Beaulieu, by Fréd E. Kroker et ux by deed dated August 4, 1942, and recorded with said Registry of Deeds, Book 981, Page 199. In order more fully to protect the security of this mortgage, the mortgagors, together with, and in addition to, the monthly payments of principal and interest payable under the terms of the note secured hereby, covenant to pay to the mortgagee until the said note is fully paid, an installment of the taxes and special assessments levied or to be levied against the mortgaged premises. Such installments shall be equal to the estimated taxes and assessments next due (as estimated by the mortgagee) less all installments already paid therefor, divided by the number of months that are to elapse before one month prior to the date when such taxes and assessments will become delinquent. The mortgagee shall hold such monthly payments in trust to pay such taxes and assessments before the same become delinquent. If the total of the payments made by the mortgagors shall exceed the amount of payments actually made by the mortgagee for taxes or assessments, such excess shall be credited by the mortgagee on subsequent payments to be made by the mortgagors. If, however, the monthly payments made by the mortgagors shall not be sufficient to pay taxes and assessments when the same shall become due and payable, then the mortgagors shall pay to the mortgagee any amount necessary to make up the deficiency, on or before the date when payment of such taxes and assessments shall be due. If there shall be a default under any of the provisions of this mortgage resulting in a sale of the mortgaged premises under the power of sale herein contained, or if the mortgagee acquires the mortgaged premises otherwise after default, the mortgagee shall apply at the time of the commencement of the proceedings under the power of sale, or at the time the mortgaged premises are otherwise acquired, the accumulated balance of said monthly installments as a credit against the amount of principal then remaining unpaid under said note. This mortgage is upon the statutory condition, for any breach of which or for any breach of any of the aforementioned provisions or conditions, the mortgagee shall have the statutory power of sale. BOOK We also release to the mortgagee all rights of tenancy by the curtesy, 142 dower and homestead, respectively, and other interests in the mortgaged premises. PAGE . WITNESS our hands and seals this eighth day of June, 1950. 252 COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS Middlesex, ss. Lowell, June 8, 1950 Then personally appeared the above named George Beaulieu and Courana L, Beaulieu and acknowledged the foregoing instrument to be their free act and deed, before me John Marvey - Notary P My commission expires Feb. 9, 1951, Rec'd & entered for record June @, 1950 at 3h. 36m. P.M. #355

column12: We, George Beaulieu and Courana L, Beaulieu, husba of Dracut, Middlesex County, Massachusetts, for consideration paid, grant to UNION NATIONAL BANK OF LOWELL, a body corporate, located at Lowell, in said County of Middlesex, with MORTGAGE COVENANTS, to secure the pay- ment of FIFTY-EIGHT HUNDRED DOLLARS ($5800), with interest from date at the rate of five per centum (5%) per annum on the unpaid balance until paid, said principal and interest being payable in installments as follows: Sixty-one — 54) in one month from date; Sixty-one and 54/100 DolNars and 54/100 Dollars ($61. pal and interest ($61.54) every month thereafter; and the final payment. of princi BOOK 1168 PAGE 8 8 in ten (10) years from date, as provided in our note of even date, and also to secure the performance of all covenants and agreements herein contained, the following described parcels of land situated in said Dracut: FIRST: The land, with the buildings thereon, situated on the Southerly side of Long Pond Drive and the westerly side of Shore Drive, and thus bounded and described: Northerly by said Long Pond Drive, one hundred ninety (190) feet; Easterly by said Shore Drive, one hundred fifty (150) feet; Southerly by land now or formerly of Bernard O'Reilly, one hundred ninety-four (194) feet; and Westerly by Long Pond, one hundred seventy (170) feet, Being shown on a plan of land entitled, ‘‘Revised Plan of Varnumtown at Long Pond Dracut, Mass. owned by F. E. Kroker,’’ surveyed Nov. 30, 1938 by Brooks, Jordan & Graves, C, E’s., and recorded with Middlesex North District: Registry of Deeds, Plan Book 61, Plan 88, Being the same premises conveyed to us by Fred E. Kroker by deed dated July 9, 1938, and recorded with said Registry of Deeds, Book 916, Page 98, See also deedsrecorded in Book 1161, Pages33 and 34, Said premises are conveyed with full business rights and the right to conduct a, bathhouse, parking, erect tourist camps or overnight cabins is - granted with this parcel of land. The above parcel of land is Subject to the following restrictions: : (a) There shall be no building, porch or projection extending over a line fifteen (15) feet from the roads bordering this parcel, (b) All buildings constructed of wood or metal must be stained or painted. | (c) There shall nét be constructed any outside toilets, (d) No part of the land hereby conveyed or ithe improvements thereon shall ever be sold, leased, traded, rented or donated to any- one other than the Caucasian race, (e) There shall be no livestock, animals or poultry kept or maintained on the property other than household pets, SECOND: The land situated on the Southerly side of Long Pond Drive, easterly side of Shore Drive, northerly side of Maple Road, and the northwesterly sid of Hillside Terrace, and thus bounded and described: Northerly by said Long Pond Drive, three hundred ninety-four and 3/100 - (394.03) feet; Westerly by said Shore Drive, one hundred seventy-five (175) feet; Southerly by said Maple Road, three hundred seventy--nine and 64/100 (379.64) feet; oe Southeasterly by said Hillside Terrace, one hundred twenty and 97/100 (120.97) feet; and | Northeasterly by said Long Pond Drive, ninety-eight and 16/100 (98.16) feet, . . Said premises are shown on said plan and are conveyed with the benefit of, and subject to, said benefits and restrictions as set forth in parcel 1, and are the same premises conveyed to said George Beaulieu and Courana L. Beaulieu, under the name of Courana Beaulieu, by Fred E, Kroker et ux by deed dated August 4, 1942, and recorded with said Registry of Deeds, Book 981, Page 199, In order more fully to protect the Security of this mortgage, the mortgagors, together with, and in addition to, the monthly payments of principal and interest payable under the terms of the note secured hereby, covenant to pay to the mortgagee until the said note is fully paid, an installment of the taxes ‘and special assessments levied or to be levied against the mortgaged premises. Such installments shall be equal to the estimated taxes and assessments next due (as estimated by the mortgagee) less all installments already paid therefor, divided by the number of months that are to elapse before one month prior to the date when such taxes and assessments will become delinquent. The mortgagee Shall hold such monthly payments in trust to pay, Such taxes and assessments before the same become delinquent, If the total of the payments made by the mortgagors shall exceed the amount of payments actually made by the mortgagee for taxes or assessments, such excess shall be credited by the mortgagee on Subsequent payments to be made by the mortgagors. If, however, the monthly . BOOK l payments made by the mortgagors shall not be sufficient to pay taxes and 4168° assessments when the same shall become due and payable, then the mortgagdrs shall pay to the mortgagee any amount necessary to make up the deficiency, on or before the date when payment of such taxes and assessments shall be due, If 8 9) there shall be a default under any of the provisions of this mortgage resulting in a sale of the mortgaged premises under the power of sale herein contained, or if the mortgagee acquires the mortgaged premises otherwise after default, the mortgagee Shall apply at the time of the commencement of the proceedings under the power of sale, or at the time the mortgaged premises are otherwise acquired, the accumulated balance of said monthly installments as a credit against .{he amount of principal then remaining unpaid under said note. PAGE This mortgage is upon the statutory condition, for any breach of which or for any breach of any of the aforémentioned provisions or conditions, the mortgagee shall have the statutory power of sale. We also release to the mortgagee all rights of tenancy by the curtesy, ‘dower and homestead, respectively, and other interests in the mortgage premises. WITNESS our hands and seals this /$ le day of May, 1951. oe enc tate g * COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS Middlesex, sS. Lowell, May /% 1961. Then personally appeared the above named George Beaulieu and Courana L. Wallace by his deed dated October 23, 1952 and recorded with said Registry in Book 1209, Page 204. Including as a part of the realty all portable or sectional buildings, heating apparatus, plumbing, ranges, mantels, storm doors and windows, oil burners, gas and oil and electric fixtures, screens, screen doors, awnings, electric and gas refrigerators, air conditioning apparatus, and other fixtures of whatever kind and nature, on said premises, or hereafter placed thereon prior to the full payment and discharge of this mortgage, insofar as the same are or can by agreement of the parties be made a part of the realty. The mortgagor further covenants and agrees to the following ADDITIONAL COVENANTS, numbered 1 to 15, both inclusive: . : 1. To perform and observe all of the terms and conditions of the mortgage note secured by this mortgage; 2 To pay to the mortgagee on the payment dates of the note secured by this mortgage, in addition to the payments of principal and interest therein required, a monthly apportionment of the sum estimated by the mortgagee to be sufficient to make all payments of all taxes, charges and assessments upon the 3. To pay on demand to the mortgagee sums equivalent to the same percentage on the debt secured _ hereby as the mortgagee shall from time to time be required to pay as a State tax on its funds invested in loans secured by mortgages of real estate ; 4, To insure in sums satisfactory to the mortgagee and for its benefit the buildings now or hereafter standing on said land against fire, and such other hazards, casualties and contingencies as the mortgagee may from time to time direct, and to deposit all such insurance policies with the mortgagee ; 5. That a foreclosure of this mortgage shall forever bar him and all persons claiming under him from to return premiums on cancellations, whether at law or in equity ; . That the mortgagor will keep all and singular the said premises in such repair and conditions as the Same are now or may be put in while this mortgage is outstanding ; . . That he will not use or permit the premises to be used in violation of any law or municipal ordinance or regulation or for any unlawful or improper purpose ; That he will not commit, permit or suffer any waste, impairment, or deterioration of the property or any part thereof; That upon default in any condition of this mortgage or the note secured hereby, the mortgagee may apply any sums credited by or due from the mortgagee to the mortgagor to cure such default without first enforcing any of the other rights of the mortgagee against the mortgagor or the mortgaged premises ; 10. That in the event this mortgage is given to secure a loan in whole or in part for the construction, alteration or repair of a building, the mortgagee may advance from time to time to the mortgagor such sums as in its-discretion appear to be warranted by the progress of the work and the mortgagor agrees to prosecute the construction, alteration or repairs involved diligently, and, in the event of any unreasonable delay, the mortgagee, in addition to any other remedy it may have, may enter and complete such construction, alteration or repairs and charge such amounts as it ‘shall reasonably ex- pend in so doing to the mortgagor whether or not he shall have parted with his title to said premises ; 2 Om NY AO 11. That the mortgagor will pay on demand to the mortgagee, or the mortgagee may at its option add to the principal balance then due, any sums advanced or paid by the mortgagee gn account of any default, of whatever nature, by the mortgagor, or any sums advanced or paid, whether before or after default, for taxes, repairs, improvements, insurance on the mortgaged property or any other insurance pledged as collateral to secure the mortgage loan, or any sums paid by the mortgagee, including reasonable attorney’s fees, in prosecuting, defending, or intervening in any legal or equitable proceeding wherein the mortgagee deems any of the rights created by this mortgage are jeopardized or in issue; 12. That this mortgage shall also secure the repayment of such future advances as the mortgagee may, from time to time and for any purpose, make to the mortgagor, and the same may be added to the mortgage debt; provided however that no advance shall be made which will increase the principal balance above the face amount of the mortgage note; 13. That upon default in any condition of the mortgage or note secured hereby existing for more than one month, the entire mortgage debt shall become due and payable on demand at the option of the mortgagee ;

Turgeon et al dated September)! , 1953, to be recorded herewith. Including as a part of the realty all portable or sectional buildings, heating apparatus, plumbing, ranges, mantels, storm doors and windows, oil burners, gas and oil and electric fixtures, screens, screen doors, awnings, electric and gas refrigerators, air conditioning apparatus, and other fixtures of whatever kind and nature, on said premises, or hereafter placed thereon prior to the full payment and discharge of this mortgage, insofar as the same are or can by agreement of the parties be made a part of the realty. , This mortgage is upon the statutory condition, and upon the further conditions: First. That the undersigned and each subsequent owner of the equity of redemption of the real estate at any time covered by this mortgage, shall at all times be a member of the said Co-operative Bank, and shall hold one or more unmatured, paid-up or matured shares, in his own name; and that the provisions of Chapter 170 of the General Laws and Chapter 293 of the Acts of 1941 and any acts, additions and amendments thereto hereinafter enacted shall at all times be complied with; and failure to comply with this requirement shall constitute a breach of condition of this mortgage, for which the unpaid balance of the loan secured by this mortgage shall become due and payable forthwith, at option of the said Bank. Second. That a further sum of $12.00 per month shall be paid to the mortgagee on the first Friday of each and every month hereafter which payments are to be applied by the mortgagee toward the payment of the taxes and assessments on said premises when and as they shall become due and any balance due thereon shall be paid by the mortgagor as provided for in said statutory condition. BOCK 1234 PAGS 270 Third. That the Mortgagor shall keep all and singular the said premises in such repair, order and condi- tion as the same are now in or may be put in while this mortgage is outstanding, reasonable wear and tear and damage by fire only excepted, and shall not permit or suffer any violation of any law or ordinance affecting the mortgaged premises. The Mortgagor shall keep the buildings now or hereafter standing on said land insured against fire and (when required by the Mortgagee) also against other casualties and contingencies, in sums satis- factory to the Mortgagee ; and all insurance upon said buildings shall be for the benefit of, and first payable in case of loss to the Mortgagee, and the Mortgagor shall deposit all of said insurance policies with the Mortgagee ; Fourth. That failure to comply with any of the other conditions under which this mortgage is written or failure to pay any of said installments within thirty (30) days fromi the date when the same becomes due notwithstanding any license or waiver of any prior breach of condition shall make the whole of the balance of said principal sum immediately due and payable at the option of the holder hereof. For any breach of the statutory condition or for any breach of any condition of this mortgage the Mort- gagee shall have the statutory power of sale. In the event the ownership of the mortgaged premises, or any part thereof, becomes vested in a person other than the Mortgagor, the Mortgagee may, without notice to the Mortgagor, deal with such successor or suc- cessors in interest with reference to the mortgage and the debt hereby secured, in the same manner as with the Mortgagor, without in any way vitiating or discharging the Mortgagor’s liability hereunder or upon the debt hereby secured. No sale of the premises hereby mortgaged and no forbearance on the part of the Mortgagee and no extension of the time for the payment of the debt hereby secured given by the Mortgagee shall operate to release, discharge, modify, change or affect the original liability of the Mortgagor herein, either in whole or part. Wherever the words Mortgagor and Mortgagee are used herein they shall include their several heirs, ex- ecutors, administrators, successors, grantees and assigns subject to the limitations of law and of this instrument, and if the context requires, the words Mortgagor and Mortgagee and the pronouns referring to them shall be construed as plural, neuter or feminine. That the undersigned and each subsequent owner of the equity of redemption of the real estate at any time covered by this mortgage, shall at all times be a member of the said Co-operative Bank, and shall hold one or more unmatured, paid-up or matured shares, in his own name; and that the provisions of Chapter 170 of the General Laws and Chapter 293 of the Acts of 1941 and any acts, additions and amendments thereto hereinafter enacted shall at all times be complied with; and failure to comply with this requirement shall constitute a breach of condition of this mortgage, for which the unpaid balance of the loan secured by this mortgage shall become due and payable forthwith, at option of the said apt x Second. For any breach of the statutory condition or for any breach of any condition of this mortgage the Mort- gagee shall have the statutory power of sale. ; In the event the ownership of the mortgaged premises, or any part thereof, becomes vested in a person other than the Mortgagor, the Mortgagee may, without notice to the Mortgagor, deal with such successor or suc- cessors in interest with reference to the mortgage and the debt hereby secured, in the same manner as with the Mortgagor, without in any way vitiating or discharging the Mortgagor’s liability hereunder or upon the debt hereby secured. No sale of the premises hereby mortgaged and no forbearance on the part of the Mortgagee and no extension of the time for the payment of the debt hereby secured given by the Mortgagee shall operate to release, discharge, modify, change or affect the original liability of the Mortgagor herein, either in whole or part. Said premises are conveyed subject to the following restrictions: 1. said lots are not to be used for business purposes; 2. no portion of any building shall be placed at a distance less than 74+ feet from the line of the adjoining lot and 15 feet distant from the front line of the lot; 3. no outside toilets may be erected thereon; 4. no part of the land hereby conveyed shall ever be conveyed, leased, traded, rented or donated to anyone who is not a member of the caucasian race. Together with an easement of right of way over the Streets, Roads, Places, Drives or Avenues shown on said plan but reserving, however, in such Streets, Roads, Places, Drives or Avenues, the right to install telegraph, telephone and electric light poles and wires, gas and water mains or to give licenses or permits for the same. All of said Streets and Community Beach are to be forever kept open for the benefit of the Lot owners, in so far as said restrictions and easements are still in force and applicable to the granted premises. This conveyance is also subject to any Grants to The Lowell Electric Light Corporation which are of record in said Registry of Deeds and which are still in force and applicable to the premises hereby con- veyed. This mortgage is upon the Statutory Condition and upon the further condition that the mortgagors, their heirs and assigns, shall deposit monthly with the mortgagee an equal proportion of the estimated annual tax assessed against seid premises, and on October 15th of each year the balance necessary to pay the current yeafs tax and all other charges and assessments levied against said premises, and upon receipt thereof said The Central Savings Bank shall pay said tax, charges and assessments. Consideration for above lot less than $100.00 The above lot or lots is subject to the following restrictions: (a) There shall be no building, porch or projection extending over a line twenty (20) feet from roads bordering each parcel or four (4) feet from each side boundary of the parcel as distinguished from the front and rear boundaries of each parcel. (b) There shall be no buildings erected or constructed on this property of a less width of 18 feet or length of 20 feet. (c) There shall be no building constructed or erected on this property other than a one family dwelling and private garage which must conform with building. All buildings constructed of wood or metal must be stained or painted with two coats of paint. (d) There shall not be constructed any outside toilets. (e) That no part of the land hereby con- veyed, or the improvements thereon, shall ever be sold, leased, traded, rented or donated to any one other than the Caucasian race. (f) There shall be no live stock animal or poultry kept or maintained on the property other than household pets. (g) The parcels hereby conveyed shall be used only for residential purposes. Leave this indenture made the sixth day of May in the year of our lord one thousand eight hundred and eighty hundred and seventy eight that Arathusa F. Dyar, widow of the first part, and James F. Sullivan of the second part do hereby lease demise and let unto James F. Sullivan said party of the second part a certain lot or parcel of land with Cottage house and 6 attatched together with half of the barn on said premises called the westerly portion or half; Also westerly half of the cellar under said barn The party of the first part hereby reserves the right to enter and use the westerly half of said barn for here ______ hire and ____during the term this lease has to___. Being premises located m the westerly side of road from Lowell to Boston and called the Albert A Dyar place. Situated in that part of Chelmsford called East chelmsford, County of Middlesex and State of Massachusetts. Said party of the second part, it is hereby agreed shall at his own expense make all necessary repairs upon said buildings, except outside repairs and he shall keep the premises hereby leased neat and orderly and allow no liquor drunk or disorderly conduct upon the premises. Said party of the first part reserves the right to cancel this lease at one month notice after two years from date and said party of the second part shall have the same privilege, It is hereby mutually agreed that neither party shall be holder by such cancellation of this lease or any damage except failure to discharge the provisions of this lease. any ___ planted by said leasee may and shall however be allowed to be properly removed.
